Reviews.Title: “The nicest people in the world run this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Royzaibel
Reviews.Content: Always smiling and happy to assist, the people in this hotel would offer to help you in things you wouldn't dare to ask. The rooms are fine, the location is great, and the hotel is very quiet and pleasent. It's not luxurious but we're leaving feeling like we're rich, all due to the service we've got. If the people you encounter matter to you more than anything else, come and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: Diegoreign
Reviews.Content: The hotel (i don't know what category is) is hidden but it is in the midst of all means of transport. and there is a bus that brings in all the sights of Rome. The receptionists are polite but do not speak Spanish, however, they have remedied with the help of "google" and it made me smile for the effort to communicate with me .. The hotel also has a restaurant and if you stayed in their hotel you have a discount of 10%. I order the Board of menus based on fish, it's delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Foxy1977
Reviews.Content: Booked based on area, price and reviews. Excellent value for money £200 for 4 nights during the 6 nations weekend. 5 mins max walk to the tube. Staff very friendly and helpful. Had room service from the target restaurant one night which was delicious (best pizza) Would be nice if there was a kettle in the room, to have a cup of coffee after a long day sightseeing. Breakfast delivered to room, all sweet things first day, so asked if they did anything else and they offered bread and ham, which was really nice. Good shower (important to me) Not noisy (welll not for a hotel in the middle of a busy city) Rooms basic, but plenty of room and clean. Picked for close to tube, however having visited rome now i wish i had stayed more central as everything is walkable, including this hotel, but it was quite a hike back at the end of a long (cold) day

Reviews.Title: “Haven in Rome ...”
Reviews.Author: aluh_15
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel accidentally since we arrived late in Rome..and this nice receptionist named ajae assisted us wonderfully giving us everything we need during our stay..definitely a home away from home..surely recommendable and will stay there when we have chance to come back..

Reviews.Title: “Not enough beds”
Reviews.Author: Alan K
Reviews.Content: Booked a triple room but there was not enough beds for more than two people. The third "bed" was folded in a chair that was supposed to become a bed when unfolded. Was not possible to sleep in due to a very thin mattress and a beam across somewhere in the middle. The hotel could not offer anything else until the next day. The solution became a improvised bed on the floor the first night. The next day we got something that was more like a bed(but not the same class a the other two beds). We were not compensated in any way for this. There were also some positive experiences. Nice breakfast(in the room) served exactly on time. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Like your own home away from home... ;)”
Reviews.Author: aluh_15
Reviews.Content: We had a late checkin because we had a hard time looking for a place to stay (since not all hotels here in Rome has an English speaking attendees). The receptionist...AJAE as I recall the name..has been very accomodating..she made as feel really at home assisting us in everything we need after we all get wet under the rain during that cold December night... A very recommendable place and I can assure that I will deffenitely be back in this hotel ..

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: HectorG_80
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room looking recently refurbished with modern facilities but at the same time keeping the character of the old building. Good location, 5min walk to the underground and 15min walk to the train station. Breakfast served to your room, quite basic but good enough, particularly given the reasonable hotel rates. On the first night they had a mistake and gave us the junior suite room instead of the standard room that we had paid for. It is worth mentioning that the standard room was much noisier than the junior suite one, being the noises from reception and other rooms and floors clearly audible during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean choice near Roma Termini”
Reviews.Author: melancholy77
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel about much last-minute research on mostly Tripadvisor which was difficult given the number of hotels in Rome. Our priorities were location to the train station, cleanliness/safety, price, and service. Target Inn hit on most of these points. First off, booked this hotel via Expedia and the hotel rates during the off-season very quite reasonable. Location is only about 10-15 minutes walking from Roma Termini train station, but could take longer with heavier luggage, more foot traffic, getting lost without directions, etc. In retrospect, there is great convenience because the Rome subway system is easy to understand (not many lines to deal with) and there is a subway/metro stop about 2 minutes walking from the hotel which I considered to be a plus. This metro stop, Republica, is one stop away from Roma Termini making it convenient for traveling to other lines. Hotel is on the third floor and options are multiple flights of stairs or a tiny elevator with a bit of charm, but slightly inconvenient due to its style, esp with bigger luggage. Hotel is near Via Nazionale with many shops, grocery store about 8 minutes walking distance, McDonalds nearby, ATM within 1 minute, and overall seemed to be safe enough around the area although a bit noisy at all hours of the night (at least from our room which overlooked Via Modena. Walking distance from sights is not bad although taking the subway out to certain locations and walking back may be a good strategy. Room was clean, modern-looking, and fairly spacious including a cabinet for hanging clothes, room safe (actually fit my 10" netbook with a little arranging), two chairs, and free wifi which was the fastest and most reliable wifi of the hotels we stayed at during our 2 week trip through Paris and Italty. Shower had decent pressure and most of the time seemed to have adequate temperature control although there were a few instances where it briefly got too cold or too warm. No tissue box and the toilet paper allowance got low at one point. As we came during the winter off-season, we got some instruction on using our room A/C unit, however its heating abilities did not seem to work well despite leaving it on for at least 10 minutes to warm up according to the front desk (we left it on for 30+ minutes, no luck, so just turned it off). I suspect if it were summer, perhaps the A/C function might work better. Sufficient room plugs and a nice extra shutter for the window. As stated before, room was noisy from foot and car traffic at all hours of the evening, so bring some earplugs. Not sure if this varied elsewhere. Breakfast is served to your room which is a nice convenience. They were flexible with choices and tried very hard to accomodate. Seemed to be a bit on the sweeter side, but included ham/prosciutto, bread, glazed croissant, yogurt, fruit juice, and coffee/tea/water. Overall, thought it was a nice touch. Our last morning we had to leave before breakfast, however they were able to accomodate us with a special tray which we appreciated. Service was mostly good, but not outstanding (I say this on degrees of positivity versus negativity). They were overall helpful with directions and information for tourist sites, however just did not have the "service above expectations" attitude that we'd experienced at some other hotels in Italy. (i.e. further recommendations for dinner other than Target Inn's own restaurant in the area although they did direct us to the supermarket and a small pizzeria for snacks). One evening, we did have a gentleman who apparently was working his first day and thus had to call his co-worker for basic information regarding travel options to the airport, nearest ATM, etc. He was very helpful and apologetic and I feel it is more responsibility on the management to train their front desk staff (prior to starting work) to answer basic questions which any tourist is expected to ask. To his credit, he did call back to our room later and provide a different ATM location that he felt was safer and closer. Overall, I suspect it is difficult in a larger city to get the best of all worlds. Target Inn is certainly an adequate hotel (given a good price point) for its location to a nearby metro stop, cleanliness, included in-room breakfast and amenities, quite functional free wifi, and the willingness of the staff to help. However, if you are looking for exceptional service with above-average knowledge of local restaurants/etc, other options may be available. I would consider staying here again if visiting Rome and the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and much much more...”
Reviews.Author: Francis D
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this fantastic hotel, 3 nights before we boarded our cruise and 3 nights after our cruise. It is very close to everything - museums, Termini station, shopping strips especially Via Nazionale. You can practically walk to everything around it - Trevi fountain, jog to and from Villa Borghese. The staff is very helpful and no unreasonable request is refused. They are very knowledgeable about everything from booking our tickets at the Borghese Museum, St. Peter's Basilica, the Vatican Museum and the Sistine Chapel. They even helped us find a church that conducts mass in English and Pilipino! The hotel is tucked and hidden from the main traffic, so you can sleep soundly after a day and night long walks. Room is very clean and it has cable TVs (We were upgraded to the junior suite, which is relatively huge!). The other two rooms that we were able to stay were comfortable, roomy and with safe deposit boxes. Breakfast is included and what you see on their website is what you get. As I said, you can request for something else if you don't like what is being offered. Since both of us are vegetarians, we asked for some special meals, e.g porridge and fruits like bananas. It was gladly provided. There is a restaurant as well on the ground floor of the building and you get 10 per cent discount if you tell them that you are booked at Target Inn. The food and wine is good! The only regret we have is we didn't stay long enough to explore other parts of Rome and Italy during our stay. Overall, it was a very pleasant experience staying in this hotel. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: jeremiahchow
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the Metro (and 2 stations away from the main train station) but off the main road which is nice (quiet). There is also a grocery nearby. The price is a bit higher than what you'd expect but the staff's friendliness and willingness to help make your stay an enjoyable one more than makes up for it; they even helped us book our tickets to the popular Rome tourist spots (and reserve 2 tickets for the Papal audience every Wednesdays) which made things less stressful and more enjoyable for us. Average breakfast (and the same everyday) and it is served in your room.

Reviews.Title: “3-Night Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dedoti
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in early September 2011. Location: OK, but not great. Close to the railway station and to the subway, but far from the more fun places of town. The area around the hotel is boring. Room: Fairly basic, but clean. AC, safe deposit box, cable TV with few channels. Service: Not very good. We had to ask for soap. There is no breakfast area, it is served in the room. The menu selection is very limited and is exactly the same every day with heavy emphasis on sugary things.Good coffee though. Free internet with a ridiculously long password - real hassle the first timeyou use it. Value/Price: Way too high for what they offer.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Domas1111
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean rooms, happy with my stay. Great central location, 10 min walk to Colosseum, 7 to Trev i fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rick2011_09
Reviews.Content: This was a great place and the best value of my holiday trip in Europe this time around. Great location, quiet, small and the staff is attentive. The staff was knowledgable and helpful and did their best to make us comfortable. Easy to get around the city as this hotel is in walking distance to many places and 5 minutes to the nearest metro bus stop; which is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice! Great location, nice staff..”
Reviews.Author: Lingaro
Reviews.Content: We were very happy about chosing this hotel. It is in a perfect and safe location, with clean and large rooms (stayed in 307). Staff is very helpful, speaking English. You can order you breakfast to be delivered to your room. Free wi-fi available in the rooms with perfect connection and speed. You can easily catch a bus (H) from Termini if you fancy a day out in Trastevere. When coming back just get off at Via Nazionale. We'll likely to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Chuck77347
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Target Inn for four nights. We had a large comfortable room for four. One double and two single beds and lots of space to move around. The room included in-room breakfast at a time selected by us and with a number of nice options for what food was included. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent. It is close to the Termini Trains Station (we walked from there in 10 min with all of our luggage) and within walking distance of many of the main attractions (Trevi Fountain). It is also one block from a metro station. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and clean'”
Reviews.Author: Sofoula13
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Target Inn! From the get go, when I reserved the room, I had emailed the hotel to ask for additional photos of the room (specifically the bathroom because the website’s virtual tour didn’t show bathroom photos and there weren’t any of the Suite bathroom pics on TripAdvisor) and they kindly obliged and sent me photos. Right away I was impressed with the customer service. The great thing about the location of Target Inn is that it’s right around the corner from the Reppublica metro station, which means that it’s a bit off the beaten path from the Roman Forum, but our preference was to stay closer to a metro stop (and to the Termini train station from where we arrived from the airport and where we would be leaving from). It occupies half of the 3rd Floor of a building full of various other Inns. In standard European fashion, there is a tiny elevator that will take 2 people and 2 bags up, but it’s a tight fit. We arrived at 10PM and were starved, Tony, the front desk guy (more on him later) recommended the hotel’s namesake restaurant downstairs, which he said will give us 10% off if we tell them we’re staying at the hotel. We initially dismissed the suggesting assuming the meal would not be very good but were left with few dining options since we got downstairs around 11:30PM to finally have dinner. We were ecstatically surprised when not only was the meal delicious (I had the most delectable homemade/handmade cheese raviolis covered in a porcini and truffle sauce), the wine amazing and the server handsome as ever, but also there were 3 different groups of Italians dining at the restaurant and not one tourist in sight!! There was live music (keyboardist who sang, accompanied by backup on his laptop) who sang various Italian songs, and then belted out the classic Hotel California. It was a fantastic first impression of Italy. We were in Rome over Palm Sunday April 2011, and booked the junior suite, room 306, (200 Euro a night), which gave us additional space to move around in, which was undoubtedly helpful for two twenty-something females trying to get ready. The service was great, Tony would ask us every evening when we arrived back at the hotel, what time we wanted breakfast the following morning, and he would deliver it to our room in the morning – absolutely perfect. Fresh fruit, yogurt, orange juice, cappuccino, croissants with jelly and Nutella spreads and crackers/melba toast we took for the road! Now a few negatives that need to be worked on: the walls in the room were scuffed and could’ve used a little Mr. Clean Magic Eraser action, and the Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom leaked water from the shower doors that (unsuccessfully) wrapped around it when using the shower. Not a deal breaker, but between the scuffed walls, chipped paint on the windows, and the leaky tub doors, it just gave a much less polished look to the room. There was a wardrobe to hang up clothes, which was helpful for a 4 day stay, a refrigerator, an electronic safe in the room, and a great flat screen tv on the wall. The overall stay was terrific, I would definitely stay there again and I would highlight recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, good service, well located”
Reviews.Author: Lillith21
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 nights at the Target Inn. I had spent ages looking at the reviews on Trip Advisor and was really pleased with my choice. There was always someone present and helpful on reception, their English was excellent and the deluxe room was large, clean and modern with good air conditioning. They were also very reassuring when we were enormously late on arrival due to a problem with our flight which meant an impromptu landing in Germany! I slept like a log although my husband did notice the traffic and other noise from about 6am - Rome is an active, noisy city so be prepared although this hotel is on a side street (which helps) and I thought it was really minimal. You're in walking distance to the major sites (though Rome is a fairly large, hilly city). I was slightly concerned about breakfast on a tray in the room but actually it was good - the team even accommodated us with an extra cappuccio in the morning. You can also get additional drinks on room service during the day. Some people had complained about finding the entrance hard to find - the hotel is small and part of a much larger building but we had no problems - have a look on Google and you can see the facade of the building which helps. They are on the 3rd floor and there is a small lift that fits 3 - 2 with luggage! Free wi-fi also worked perfectly. All in all I'd highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: LCC79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days of our honeymoon and really enjoyed it. The hotel has a very clean and modern feel to it. We were originally in a standard double room--it was not too big but fine for us. After two nights we received a free upgrade to the junior suite, which was extremely large with a jacuzzi tub. 2 big pros of this hotel: location and people. It's in a decent area that we felt safe in. In addition, whenever we returned 'home' at night, the door is closed to the building and the desk clerk must buzz you in, so that added to the safety in the building. We also found the employees to be very friendly and accommodating. The beds were a little hard but I think that is more of the European standard. Also, after we visited some other hotels later in our trip and were able to pick from a wide selection of foods at breakfast, we realized how limited the breakfast had been at the Target Inn. After three days of the same croissants and yogurt, we were starting to get burned out. But overall the food was still tasty and it was kind of fun having breakfast in the bedroom where we had more privacy. The metro station (Repubblica) is close by, so as long as the workers aren't on strike, it's convenient to walk to and get around town. We ate at the little cafe there by the station, it is nothing fancy but we definitely enjoyed pizza and beer while people-watching in the piazza. We also ate at the Target Restaurant, the service is slow (European standard) but you do get a 10% discount due to staying at the hotel, so if you are looking for something convenient with a nice outdoor sitting area, it's fine. We would stay here again. Customer service is a big deal to me and this place really had it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and value”
Reviews.Author: Netwiz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days with my wife on a break. The 'inn' is in a building in a back street with what appear to be a number of hotels in different floors and corridors. So this is effectively a number of rooms off a corridor - which actually works fine. Ajay on the front desk was great from the moment we walked in, and she was ever helpful in suggesting places to visit, and pointing them out the map. When my wife felt unwell for a day she and the owner were again helpful, offering to order in food. We had ordered a standard room, which turned out not have a bath, just a shower (which doesn't bother me, but my wife likes a bath), and we were able to get the superior room at a discount, as it was free anyway. There's no restaurant or dining area, so breakfast is brought into your room when you want it. The location is great, very close to public transport, bars, restaurants, in the centre. There is a supermarket a few minutes walk if you want to stock up on nibbles or drinks for the room. You can also ask the front desk for coffee, which is very good. There is free wi-fi. The only thing stopping a five star rating is that the lack of double glazing, which would have helped with the street noise - although it wasn't awful, and there's no reason to expect other places would be any better. My wife found the bed a little hard, but this again appears to be the norm in most hotels. Overall it's a great place to stay, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: ingridru
Reviews.Content: A great option when you want to be close to the main train station, walking distance to sights and also close to the Number 64 bus route. The staff were extremely helpful and we would definitely stay next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: slimK
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay at the Bellesuite Roma but happily enough ended up spending three nights here. Ajae, the manager, is incredibly competent and will make your stay everything you hoped it would be. I highly recommend this hotel for both it's location and the well-appointed, clean rooms. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn038
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Target Inn and really enjoyed it. The bedroom and bath were very large, nicely furnished, and very clean. The staff was wonderful - helpful and friendly. Before our trip, Ajae communicated with us and answered all our questions. The hotel has a great location with lots of restaurants and bars close by, with easy access to public transportation. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel desk service and reception”
Reviews.Author: RayK56
Reviews.Content: We came back to Rome to end a 3 week vacation and stayed 3 nights at the Target Inn. Ajae, the young lady at reception was/is one of the best front desk people I have encountered in the world. (if you are in the hotel business in Rome, you should hire this girl) Extremely helpful and knowledgable she made the stay worth the cost. The room we had was the last one, a suite and a bit over priced but was very clean and well appointed (for Italy). Howvever this is Rome and not a cheap place to travel to. This place was much better than our first three nights in Rome at Il Covo B&B,. Having breakfast delivered to your room was very nice and relaxing. I would stay there again,

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Out There”
Reviews.Author: Mike111687
Reviews.Content: It was a very pleasant stay. Breakfast was great and the receptionists were all friendly and very helpful. The room was very cozy, clean and quiet. Sheets and Towels are changed everyday and I always come back to a clean room. I will definitely come back on my next stay. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back again :-)”
Reviews.Author: XtineJ
Reviews.Content: I will definitely recommend Target Inn to my friends and family. And I am certain that we shall be back in the same hotel again on our next visit. The receptionists were all very nice, approachable and very hospitable. The rooms are all very clean and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff = great trip!”
Reviews.Author: hspee
Reviews.Content: The Target Inn was recommended to us by some aquaintances who had stayed there previously. The Target Inn was the perfect choice for us! Great location, safe area and close to many attractions. Rooms are very nice and spacious and it's great to have breakfast brought to your room each morning. I can't say enough about the staff (especially AJ) - they really took the time to help us with whatever we needed and made our stay great. I would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou Thankyou Thankyou”
Reviews.Author: lizosser
Reviews.Content: I would not hesitate to recommend the Target Inn to anyone looking for accommodation in Rome. The staff are freindly, helpful and well presented. The reception operates 24 hours a day and the staff will book sightseeing tours. The room we had was modern, well furnished, clean and bright. The hotel is conveniently situated, secure, close to many attractions and only a ten minute easy walk to the train station. Breakfast is served in your room at a time convenient to you. There is a restauant situated next door so that at the end of a long day, you don't have to go far to get a great meal. If I returned to Rome I would most definately stay there again. Thanks to all the staff especially AJ L&B Offer Western Australia, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: KiwiScotsTauranga
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Target Inn after a long haul flight from New Zealand. We were tired and had a grumpy 3 year old in tow. What a relief to arrive to such a friendly welcome. The rickety but very charming old lift was a big hit with the 3 year old although we did need two trips to get all our bags upstairs. The room was spacious and clean but the biggest plus for us was that the staff were both helpful and extremely tolerant of our wee boy. Nothing was too much trouble from booking activities and helping arrange our hire car pick up to warm milk at bedtime. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wild, rickety old-style elevator, great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: kecweric
Reviews.Content: Location: Ideal for anyone that has to be near the train station, but not too close. It was a 10 minute schlep over bumpy curbs and cobblestones to the hotel. Doable with small carry on luggage, but I wouldn't want to try this with large luggage. Room: Spacious room, quiet, clean bathroom. Only complaint is that the shower is very, very tiny. I'm a medium sized guy, and I kept bumping my elbows on the walls when I was washing myself. Breakfast: The included breakfast, delivered to the room, was great. Beats the other pensione we'd stayed at. The front desk staff even refilled my espresso once for me. Staff: Very friendly front desk staff. No problems with left luggage. I had some cell phone issues, and the front desk person helped me get through using the house phone. I'd stay here again, although I'd try to negotiate for a lower price first. We paid 150 Euro cash for a direct booking by phone. I'd shoot for 130 or lower.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel staff we´ve ever been with and comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: LuigiBasilicata
Reviews.Content: We´ve been many times in Rome, but this one was special because it is too important for us to choose a nice hotel to have a nice stay in the city. We did so, Target Inn for us is the perfect choise, too peaceful since there are only seven rooms, very close to the train station, shops and restaurants, and of course, close to all the atractions of Rome like the Coliseo, Fontana di Trevi, Piazza Spagna and the Capitolino museum. It has comfortable rooms with modern furniture and they are very clean. Target Inn has the best hotel staff we´ve ever been with, very kind and totally helpful, you can ask them whatever you need and they try to help you in any way possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, modern and great staff, very helpful”
Reviews.Author: kirstypettit
Reviews.Content: The target inn was the perfect location, very quiet and we could easily walk everywhere. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms are spotlessly clean and very modern - like being home from home. The only downside is the breakfast, not much choice and if your a gluten intolerant like myself is was quite tricky (take your own bread!). But otherwise highly recommended, i would choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: eastenderCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Owner of Hotel and restaurant a true friend in need!!!! We had a wonderful anniversary dinner in his restaurant which was delicious with a great table looking out at the street. It felt like we were in a movie on the perfect anniversary after 30 years together. He even helped us find a great place to stay in Florence when we left.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be staying again on our next trip to Rome.”
Reviews.Author: January561
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Rome in 10 months. After dining at the Target Restaurant, last January, we decided to try the Target Inn for this trip. Target Inn exceeded our expectations of a small hotel. Our room was large, we booked a Junior Suite for seven nights. The bathroom was spacious with a jacuzzi tub, an added plus. We cannot say enough good things about the staff! Everyone was great, but especially the young woman who was at the front desk every day from dawn to dusk. She was so helpfully in answering our questions, giving us directions to various sites of interest and in making our dinner reservations at various restaurants.The Target Restaurant is very, very good also. When we book our next trip to Rome, we will be booking with Target Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “If I were going back to Rome again, I would stay here in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: MPauley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely experience at the Target Inn in Rome, IT. The staff at the Inn were OUTSTANDING, very professional and yet very welcoming. They helped us arrange many things during our two week stay there including tours, taxis, laundry services and recommendations for things not to miss during our stay. The room was just the right size and was very clean. We had a wonderful and very memorable stay and would love to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellemt!”
Reviews.Author: Josie077
Reviews.Content: Arriving late in the evening we found the reception staff friendly, welcoming, providing a very swift check-in and even helping with the luggage & showing us to the room. The room was spacious for a smaller city centre hotel, very clean and with contemporary modern decor - the rooms DO look like the pictures on the hotel's website!! The bathroom was also modern and wonderfully clean with complimentary toiletries supplied & plenty of freshly laundered towels. Also the shower pressure was fantastic and there was always plenty of hot water whatever time of day. Breakfast was delivered to the room every morning at the specific time we requested - never late . It was a continental style brekfast with fresh croissants, bread, jams/spreads and coffee - and was lovely. The staff were always very courteous & helpful guiding us as which where the best forms to transport to get to the many sites that Rome has to offer - giving us a detailed city map - bus routes & nos, metro stops & which line to take. Ensuring we never got lost & were able to see all that we hoped to in the 4 days we were there. I do not hesitate to recommend the Target Inn and on my next visit to Rome will be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel with amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: traveller01331
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Target Inn for a weekend and can highly recommed it. Clean and modern rooms, comfortable beds, new bathroom, quite and last but least an incredibly helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, small hotel! Get there!”
Reviews.Author: emoticon
Reviews.Content: The target inn is a great, small hotel. The rooms are spacious, modern and very clean. The staff is extremely friendly, gave us a map and explained the most important sights. Breakfast is brought to your room, since the hotel has no breakfast room, but it was no problem at all. Good coffee, croissants - not a great choice but ok. It is well located with bus stops and the metro just around the corner. The hotel even has a small tavern, where we had dinner the first night - very good Italian food and a good choice if you arrive late in the evening and you do not want to walk a lot. They have a new management and therefore there was NO problem with credit card charges, as reviewers said before. I can just highly recommend this hotel if you want a clean, friendly, reasonable accomodation in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near rail station!”
Reviews.Author: sonyisda1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location - walking distance from central station and many sites. The room was very comfortable and the staff spoke perfect english (a welcome sign being in a foreign country). Breakfast was delivered to the room and the free wi-fi available. And based on what others described about their hotel experiences in Rome, this place had a nice shower with hot water and drained with no problem! Definitely a recommended place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Do not give credit card details - Fraudulent use”
Reviews.Author: RichnLiss
Reviews.Content: Similar to 2 other reviews on this site, DO NOT give your card details to this place. I had booked 2 nights in July last year, cancelled 1 night - more than 48 hours in advance (so no charges should have been applied for the cancelled night). Upon arrival I was given a receipt for the 2 nights charge. I was assured I would be refunded, and to this day nothing has appeared. A good friend who speaks Italian referred me to this place, and now she feels dreadful and is trying to speak to Natale to arrange for my refund. They have tried to tell me that they cannot transfer funds to an overseas bank account, nor can they refund to a credit card, but they can send me a EUR cheque to Qatar! Despite the good location and what appear to be reasonable rates, this place is not reasonable when your cost of stay doubles because they over charge. Had there not been this issue with my credit card I would have recommended this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Do not book or give credit card details”
Reviews.Author: CardiffLouise
Reviews.Content: I would love to tell you how this B&B is, but unfortunately will never be staying there to let you know. I booked 4 nights in April for my honeymoon and when asked for my credit card details as confirmation they took 600 euros. After 4 months I still have not received this back and my credit card company are dealing with it. They did contact me apologising and agreeding to refund but to no avail. This B&B was recommended by a friend, who now feels awful about it - unfortuantely I cannot recommend it. Please be very careful when they ask you for your details.

Reviews.Title: “Beware travellers!”
Reviews.Author: snowgumaustralia
Reviews.Content: I had 2 nights booked at the Target Inn on 1st and 2nd July 2008 through Worldby.com, however I was forced to cancel my booking as my children were sick. My Italian family in Umbria phoned the hotel on 30th June to notify them of this cancellation and I agreed to allow them to charge my credit card for one night's accommodation, as per their cancellation policy. Upon my return to Australia, I was surprised to see that Target Inn had already debited my card for the full amount of 360 Euros upon reservation, i.e.6th June. This was not in accordance with their booking conditions. I have e-mailed and phoned them several times and am frustrated by their lack of refunding one night's accommodation. i.e. 180 euros. Nadia and Elena at Customer Assistance Worldby.com tried really hard to help me in this, and obtained a promise by the owner that she would refund, however this never eventuated. They just seem powerless to stop greedy hotel keepers from debiting travellers cards when they do not have authorisation. Avoid this place, if you don't want the hotel owner Mariagrazia using your credit card as she wishes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: DrDinMadison
Reviews.Content: The Target Inn was a wonderful, wonderful find. Charming and delightful, great location, quiet, and able to accommodate a family easily. We were in Rome for 4 days/three nights on a family trip (2 parents, 2 children). We chose the Target Inn because of its central location: walkable, even with a 6 year old, to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and the train station. Very close to a metro stop, so the Colosseum and St. Peter's were reachable as well. The hotel takes up part of the 3rd floor of a building made up almost entirely of small B&Bs. Our room was spacious, and the beds comfortable (although the extra beds that the kids used would not be comfortable for an adult). The staff could not possibly have been nicer. Warm and welcoming, they gave us restaurant advice and an extra cup of cappuccino in the morning--served 10 minutes after the first so it wouldn't get cold--because my wife liked it so much. On the day we left we had a 9pm flight, but since our room was not booked for the evening, the staff offered to let us keep our bags in the room and even freshen up in the afternoon before leaving for the airport. The continental breakfast was promptly served, with a cornetto, coffee (chocolate for the kids), and juice. The room was spacious and clean, quiet and most pleasant. Those looking for perfection would be disappointed: minor scuffs on the walls, some old grout in the bathroom, and some of the spreads with ink-marks or other imperfections. There were some inconsistencies in the service, but they were all dealt with quickly and with grace. For example, there was no hairdryer in the room when we arrived, but the staff quickly provided one. One day they left too few towels in the room. We had more as soon as we asked. The internet was down while we were there, and as a result we had to pay our bill in cash. So if you are looking for big-hotel efficiency and five-star attention to detail, this isn't the place for you. It felt, actually, more like being a guest in someone's house that was well-set-up for having guests rather than staying in a hotel. The staff were never intrusive and always helpful. We would be happy giving the Inn 5 stars, but we wouldn't want to be misleading as to the imperfections we saw. But for us, the friendliness of the staff, the location, and the quality of the rooms overall more than made up for it. This was a wonderful hotel for us, and we would happily stay there again on another visit. We saw some of the more recent negative reviews on the site, and might mention that the owner (who was at the front desk most of the time we were at the hotel) said he had a falling out with a partner some time back, and that there had been some problems with service in that period. We booked directly with the hotel and had no problems. Our stay was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “oh no!! horrible place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: miltrav
Reviews.Content: Please don't waste your money on this place. I notice that all of the reviews that gave the Target Inn a positive rating are older posts. I'm guessing that things have really gone down hill for the Target Inn since then! We booked our hotel room directly through the hotel through phone calls and emails, which was difficult since they don't speak English well and we don't speak Italian. When we arrived our room wasn't ready and they told us to come back in a few hours!! when we came back they told us that they didn't have any hot water and that we couldn't stay there but they were going to put us up in an apartment a few blocks away instead. We were disappointed but we went along with it. When we got to the apartment, it was freezing, dirty and we had to share it with another couple who we didn't even know! within a few hours the power went out and we were left in the dark. to make matters worse, the toilets started to overflow and the hallway had an inch of nasty water on it!!! We called the manager, Natale, and told him that we had no lights,heat or working toilets and he said that he would be right over. 5 hours later, at 1am, he came with candles and offered no apologies for the bad conditions. He said that he would return to check on us, but he never did. The lights came back on at 3am and my husband and I walked the 4 blocks or so back to the Target Inn and demanded our money back. The guy at the desk was sleeping on the floor with a blanket and pillow and gave us a really hard time about getting a refund. All he could do, he said, was take our address and send us our money. Well, it's been a month and we are still waiting for a refund!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: findley2
Reviews.Content: I contacted the hotel through their website at 11pm the night before arrival (I was staying at a nearby hotel and needed to change due to the terrible conditions). They could take me and when I arrived early the next morning and the room wasn't ready, they made me a cappuccino and finished up ASAP. The hotel was a dream: a/c, private bath, elevator to the hotel, sky TV and breakfast to your door. I would highly reccommend it! It was a good deal too at 60euro a night through their website.

Reviews.Title: “We were charged twice for our stay!”
Reviews.Author: vmoe
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Target In was just fine, but since they and their booking agent WorldBy.com charged us twice for this stay, we have to give it lowest possible score. If they had responded when we emailed them, telling them about the double charge, everything would have been fine. We have not heard one single word from them after we told them about their mistake. Sorry to say this, but due to this we really feel we have to give a general warning about making any bookings through WorldBy.com.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: JoanofOz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I who are "oldies" booked the Target Inn on the web for a stay of 3 days and hoped that it came up to our expectations and we were not disappointed. The Inn is in a complex with other B&B it has seven rooms and is quiet. The Inn was on the 3rd floor and the day we arrived the lift was broken - the manager personally carried our bags up to our room - a supreme effort fortunately the lift was quickly repaired. The twin room was large, modern and the beds comfortable. The bathroom was well appointed and immaculately clean. The breakfast was brought to our room daily and was basic but adequate. The TV had cable and English channels. The management and staff spoke good English and assisted us in every way including helping us with our problem of having to get replacement credit cards for one's that we had had to cancel. Target Inn is very well situated being just around the corner from Via Nazionale and the Republic handy to transport and restaurants.There is a Target Restaurant situated on the corner of the street and we were impressed with the service and menu choices. We would recommend Target Inn for its price, comfort and warm welcoming staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FairOaksDreamer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Target Inn for five nights and hated to leave. The location is just as great as other reviewers have said, the rooms are very nice and modern and the staff is exceptional. Even the maid was welcoming, as she taught me a little Italian every morning when she delivered our breakfast! The staff arranged a ride to and from the airport by car (our driver Fabrizio was great and very reliable). Every evening they would suggest places to tour the next day, and we found that we saw so much more of Rome than we anticipated. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Aristita
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, friendly staff, huge room nicely decorated. The bathroom had a whirlpool tub, perfect for after a long day walking. The breakfast was served in the room, but was quite limited in selection; a tipical continental breakfast, although of very good quality. The location was perfect, close to Termini and all the tour buses, as well as in a walking distance of all atractions. The only challenge is finding it first time, as the name doesn't appear anywhere obvious on the building. The ground floor of the building has on the corner of Modena and Torino a Target restaurant. If you find the restaurant, you are close to the hotelentrance, but don't stop at the door, go directly to the 4th floor. If the door is locked, ring the bell for Target. In the same building there are a few other similar small hotels. If you arrive at night, bring a flashlight! Definitely a place to keep in mind for a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Target Inn was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: chantelSydney
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week stay at Target inn, Rome and we highly recommend it. The staff were very friendly, accommodating and recommended some fantastic local resturants. We stayed in the suite that was fantastic value-huge room with a spa bath and cable TV with lots of English channels. It was also in a convenient location-walking distance to the centre. It had the most comfortable bed, air conditioning and was very clean. We definately will be staying there for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Target Inn hitting the spot in Rome”
Reviews.Author: wjgrnp
Reviews.Content: My family (4) and I stayed at the Target Inn for 4 nights in the last week of July 2007. The Hotel is warm and friendly and because of its size you are made to feel welcome and exclusive at the same time. The staff and owners are a delight to deal with and certainly make your stay as pleasurable as possible. The location is very central ( Via Modena) although you are not confrounted with traffic noise or other traditional draw backs when living in the centre of such a fast moving city. We will hang our hats at the Target Inn on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: Eur0Travellers
Reviews.Content: The room was better than my wife and I expected. It exceeded all our expectations in terms of cleanliness, luxury, comfort, location, facilities, value for money and friendly and helpful staff. I highly recommend this luxury B&B. We will definately be staying again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Jelsey
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little, 7-room hotel right in the heart of Rome, a short walking distance from the Stazione Termine. We stayed at the Target Inn for 10 days in July and couldn't have found a more comfortable home-away-from-home. Stefano and all his staff (especially Alessandra and Cynthia) were kind and helpful throughout our entire stay. They were so friendly and always ready with suggestions and advice on any queries we had about Rome. We were also making and receiving many phone calls each day and the staff was very patient and cooperative about that. They were forever passing on messages to us. Our room was large, always clean, nicely decorated and we loved the wonderful high ceiling. It felt spacious and very comfortable. The air-conditioning worked great and was much appreciated during the heatwave we experienced there. And we enjoyed having Sky TV, which gave us an infinite choice of channels and programs in both English and Italian. The room was very quiet (except for the night Italy won the World Cup!). The continental breakfast served in our room each morning gave us a great start to the day. As far as location is concerned, it was perfect for us. The Metro station is only a couple of minutes away at Piazza Esedra, and the hotel is just around the corner from the Via Nazionale, where you can catch a bus to almost any place. Many sightseeing attractions are within a moderate walking distance from the hotel. There are plenty of bars and 'tavola caldas' in the area, not to mention restaurants. And there is even a supermarket nearby on the Via Nazionale. Would we go back to the Target Inn? Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: moynishan
Reviews.Content: Stephen and his staff were excellent! They even booked us a reservation at the Borghese prior to our arrival (I would highly recommend this service and museum). We booked the suite since no regular rooms were available, so I can only speak of the suite here in this review as for the room itself, which was very clean and spacious - even the bathroom. We did get our room cleaned everyday. The TV was big, but only 2 English speaking channels (both of which were news channels, so having at least EuroSport in English would have been nice, esp since the Giro d'Italia was going on at the time). The breakfast was only OK, but the coffee was decent and getting Nutella as one of the 'jelly' choices is really great! Having it served in the room was pretty nice as well - having a quick snack in while getting ready is a good start to the day. The water in the shower was a bit odd - cold then hot, then cold then hot (rarely together to make it warm) and only half of a shower 'curtain' (enclosed glass that went in a half circle) so water would get on the floor; however, this seems to be pretty standard for Europe so it's just a part of the experience really. The location is great - less than a 10 minute walk to Termini and the Via Nazionale shopping district is just steps away. Not a far walk to other sites either (Trevi and the Spanish Steps is maybe 20 mins or less). We ended up renting a bike from Baci & Bici which was great - although they don't rent helmets (riding in Roma rush hour w/ no helmet is a wee bit scary, but if I did it ...), so bring one if you go this route - cheaper than public transportation, more reliable and no fear of someone reaching in your pocket. Of course, you can rent a motor scooter as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, hotel just okay”
Reviews.Author: chris49
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in this hotel for one week. I must admit to start with there were a few little things that could have been better, but over the course of the week the Target Inn really grew on us. Just to mention the problems: we had four hangers for our clothes between the two of us, there is no shelf in the bathroom to put toiletries on, the "free Sky" tv wasn't working and the breakfast wasn't really up to much. Having said all this, we could not fault the staff who went out of their way for us, especially Gianna and the gentleman who spoke absolutely perfect English. The hotel itself is in a prime position, right in the centre - the room was absolutely spotless, every other day we had clean sheets and towels. Our room was quite quiet - we only had one night with a bit of noise - people shouting in the street at 3 in the morning. We arrived early, but the room was ready for us which was great as we'd been travelling practically all night. From previous reviews on this site, we understood that breakfast would be served in a local cafe/bar, but it is now served in the room. This was not really a problem, but neither my mother nor I are really into sweet croissants which is basically all you get (oh, and a few hard biscuits). We both prefer "proper" bread for breakfast! There are many restaurants and bars in the area, Termini is 10 minutes walk away and the bus stop in Via Nazionale is two minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Right on 'Target'”
Reviews.Author: hjoEmeraldHills_CA
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best places we've ever stayed with regards to price, quality, location and service. We booked at Orbitz for about $440 for four nights/2 people, inclusive of taxes. It is a small, clean and modern hotel. The room we stayed in was #307: spacious room and bathroom. The only not-so-high-mark was that our heater was rather noisy and we could not get the room to a consistent, comfortable temperature; thus our mornings would be cooler than what we would have liked. Otherwise, we enjoyed our stay immensely and would recommend it to our friends and family. Note: once arriving in Termini station, don't even consider getting on the Metro with luggage: imagine "sardines in a metal tube"...not pretty. We realized we could have walked from Termini to this hotel. For getting around, the Repubblica Metro station is about a 2 minute walk to the hotel. Check what time the Metro stops running as it stops pretty early (around 9pm). For you shopaholics with tons of luggage, there is a lift from the ground floor of the hotel building. Finally, expect breakfast at the cafe around the corner to be your typical Italian breakfast: croissant, cappucino, toast and jelly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to saty!”
Reviews.Author: skevola
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Target Inn recently and was really impressed with this B&B. The rooms are gorgeously decorated, the bathroom is in perfect shape (the Inn was refurbished recently, in September I believe) and it has a great remote control heating system (air conditioning in summer, I understand). The staff was super helpful and friendly (made a great recommendation for dinner) and the location was unbelievable, with a Metro station within a couple of minutes distance and a bus that take you directly to St Peter. You can also walk to visit ancient Rome (Coliseum, etc) and most of the other city attractions. The price was excellent (100 euros per room per night), compared to other hotels and B&B I had checked out. I’m taking one star off for two reasons: the room was a teeny bit noisy and the breakfast was *only* okay.

Reviews.Title: “The Target hits the bulls eye”
Reviews.Author: Rpsjensen
Reviews.Content: In this small 7-room hotel, we were pleasantly surprised by our room. The room was large with a big LCD TV, minibar, whirlpooltub, and safe. It is larger then many 5-star hotels. Even though some staff did not speak much english (one told us the breakfast is served until 10.30 on sunday, so we rushed ourselves on sundaymorning to breakfast at 9.00 and the cafe wasn't open until 10.00). The service was great though! You can walk around the city day or night with a great narrative to the type of history that has occured throughout this wonderfully ancient city. It was very clear that you need to be alert with your belongings through various posted and verbal warnings, however we were careful and nothing happened. It is centrally located. You have a 5-10 minute walk to: Repubblica, Termini Station for metro, bus and train. The following are maximum 25 minutes walk away: Via del Corso, Via Condotti, Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain, Colloseum. We took the metro from Repubblica to the Vatican and it is only a few stops away. The hotel has all the signs of becoming highly rated at Tripadvisor, just like BelleSuite hotel and Residenza Celini which is also located on the 3rd floor of this building.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Porridge99
Reviews.Content: This trendy, hip and art-deco hotel is located right next to residenza cellini (same building, same floor). The hotel is new (a couple of months old) and it feels and smells new. The rooms are tastefully decorated and the location is very central. This is the first hotel where I found a separate liquid soap for your body (shower) and another one for, how shall I put it, your behind :-) The hotel is very close to the main train station and a bunch of restaurants some of which are very touristy. Avoid the restaurant called Zeus (close to the hotel - you will probably see it), unless you like microwaved pizza. The staff was very helpful and stored my excess luggage for a week while my wife and I were touring around Italy.

HotelInfo.Name: Target Inn
HotelInfo.Address: Via Modena 5, 00184 Rome, Italy
